metadata.title: Letter from Royal Thai Legation to President A. H. Upham, June 2, 1942
metadata.creator: Royal Thai Legation, Students' Department
metadata.description: A letter from the Royal Thai Legation's Students' Department to President A. H. Upham of Miami University, expressing gratitude and admiration for the university's work.
metadata.transcript:
ROYAL THAI LEGATION STUDENTS’ DEPARTMENT
2300 KALORAMA ROAD WASHINGTON,D.C.

June 2, 1942

President A. H. Upham
Miami University
Oxford, Ohio

Dear President Upham:

Just a line, upon my return to the Legation, to thank you for the many courtesies which were shown to me while I was at the University, and to tell you again how proud I am of the wonderful work which you are doing there. There is a charm and a dignity about the place which I had never so thoroughly felt before. If only I could now be looking backward to the pleasure of having been the agency through whom you secured yesterday's Commencement speaker, my cup would indeed be running over. I shall still hope in that direction!

Kindest regards to Mrs. Upham and yourself.

Sincerely yours,

[HANDWRITTEN: Murray Stickham]
